result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Hanson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost on Count 1 and $265.60 fine/cost on Count 3 to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office- this will be added to currently existing payment plan. Defendant has 90 days to become current on payment plan. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must provide DNA sample and pay one $200.00 DNA surcharge.

Must be in full compliance with Mental Health regimen- both therapy and medication. 
Must take injectible medication if available and if covered by insurance or if available at a reasonable cost.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  
Not to have alcohol in the house. 
Not to have abusive contact with: Angela Squires.
Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
